sentence.Network_en: The test can accurately predict what a bigger explosion would do.
sentence.Network_cn: 该试验能准确地预测一次更大爆炸的威力。

sentence.Network_en: A much bigger battle is ahead for the president.
sentence.Network_cn: 一场更为艰巨的战斗正等待着总统。

sentence.Network_en: A bigger objection is that aggregation of the results invites distortion.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种更大的异议是把各种结果集中考虑容易导致曲解。

I was hoping for a bigger house ., 我原来希望得到更大的房子.

we are here for a bigger problem : a report published by the National Development and Reform Commission estimated that 60 percent of new graduates are facing unemployment this year .我们到这里来是一个更大的问题：出版的一份报告，国家发展和改革委员会估计，有六成新的毕业生，今年面临失业。
the industry can supply the hardware and software , but the bigger problem is the " wetware " -people , economics and politics .这个行业提供硬件和软件，但是最大的问题是”湿件”-人、经济和政治。

encyclopedia.content: bigger是英文单词big的比较级，表示更大。后街男孩歌曲Bigger是后街男孩专辑This is us 中的第2首歌的名字。

entry.def: A big person or thing is large in physical size.

example.tran: 澳大利亚是个幅员辽阔的国家。

example.ex: Her husband was a big man...

entry.def: Something that is big consists of many people or things.

example.ex: The crowd included a big contingent from Ipswich.
example.tran: 人群中有来自伊普斯威奇的一个人数众多的代表团。

entry.tran: 严重的；重大的；大幅度的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a problem, increase, or change as a big one, you mean it is great in degree, extent, or importance.

example.ex: Her problem was just too big for her to tackle on her own...
example.tran: 她的问题太严重了，光靠她自己是没法解决的。

example.ex: There could soon be a big increase in unemployment.
example.tran: 失业人数可能很快就会出现大幅增长。

entry.def: A big organization employs many people and has many customers.

example.ex: Exchange is largely controlled by big banks.
example.tran: 货币兑换业务主要由大银行控制。

example.ex: ...one of the biggest companies in Italy.
example.tran: 意大利最大的公司之一

entry.def: If you say that someone is big in a particular organization, activity, or place, you mean that they have a lot of influence or authority in it.

example.ex: Their father was very big in the army...
example.tran: 他们的父亲在军中很有影响力。

example.ex: I'm sure all the big names will come to the club.
example.tran: 我相信所有的大人物都会到这个俱乐部来。

entry.tran: （强调厌恶之深）十足的，突出的
entry.def: If you call someone a big bully or a big coward, you are emphasizing your disapproval of them.
Children often refer to their older brother or sister as their big brother or sister.
Capital letters are sometimes referred to as big letters.
Big words are long or rare words which have meanings that are difficult to understand.

example.ex: They use a lot of big words.
example.tran: 他们使用很多生僻的词汇。

entry.def: If you make it big, you become successful or famous.

example.ex: We're not just looking at making it big in the UK, we want to be big internationally.
example.tran: 我们不仅想在英国取得成功，还想在国际上扬名立万。

entry.def: If you think big, you make plans on a large scale, often using a lot of time, effort, or money.

example.ex: Maybe we're not thinking big enough.
example.tran: 也许我们的抱负还不够远大。

entry.def: If something is happening in a big way, it is happening on a large scale.

example.ex: I think boxing will take off in a big way here.
example.tran: 我想拳击运动在这儿会有很大的发展。

means.word_mean: 1. large or big relative to something else

auth_sentence.content: We will come back bigger and stronger next year.
auth_sentence.res_content: We will come back bigger and stronger next year.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We will come back bigger and stronger next year.

auth_sentence.content: They made it bigger for me and my chair.
auth_sentence.res_content: They made it bigger for me and my chair.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They made it bigger for me and my chair.

auth_sentence.content: The bigger they come, the harder they fall!
auth_sentence.res_content: The bigger they come, the harder they fall!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The bigger they come, the harder they fall!

Sentence.sentence: Although many other big firms resisted the temptation to over-borrow, developers borrowed heavily and built bigger and fancier hotels as if the whole world were planning a holiday in Las Vegas.
This disparity (差异) suggests the memory of our previous meal may have a bigger influence on our appetite than the actual size of the meal.
This slippery slope of eroding ethics and bigger risks leads only to disaster.

But a bigger problem may be that poor high schools often send their students to colleges for which they are "undermatched": they could get into more elite, richer schools, but instead go to community colleges and low-rated state schools that lack the resources to help them.
